supernatural encounter  transformation<SEP>haunting  redemption<SEP>executorship  administration<SEP>partnership  friendship marley scrooge scrooge and marley were partners and friends  with scrooge being marley s sole executor and administrator<SEP>scrooge is confronted by marley s ghost  which is a supernatural encounter that has a profound impact on scrooge<SEP>scrooge is haunted by the ghost of his former business partner  marley  who is trying to warn him of the error of his ways<SEP>scrooge is the executor  administrator  and assign of marley s estate  indicating a close relationship between the two characters

opposition  financial concerns christmas scrooge scrooge is opposed to christmas  viewing it as a time for financial burdens and not a time for joy and celebration

attempts to bring joy  resistance<SEP>connection  unwillingness<SEP>family dynamics  resistance to change scrooge scrooge s nephew scrooge and his nephew have a strained relationship  with scrooge being resistant to his nephew s attempts to bring joy and festive spirit to him<SEP>scrooge s nephew is trying to connect with scrooge and bring him into the holiday spirit  but scrooge is unwilling to reciprocate<SEP>scrooge s nephew tries to bring joy and festive spirit to scrooge  but is met with resistance and disapproval
